column1: # These rules have been generated using ChatGPT:

column2: response
Hi there! I can help you learn facts about penguins!
Hi there! Would you like to here some fun facts?
Hello! I can say some facts about coding!
Hi! fun fact: I say fun facts!
Hey there! I say fun facts about a bunch of different things!
Good morning! Ready to hear some fun facts?
Trivia is small bits of information that are often surprising!
Sure! Did you know the longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years?
Of course! Did you know that octopuses have nine brains?
Here’s one: A cow-bison hybrid is called a "beefalo."
Sure thing! Did you know apples float because they are 25% air?
Alright! Did you know koalas have fingerprints that are nearly indistinguishable from humans?
Happy to help! Did you know humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas?
Here’s a cool fact: The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died.
You got it! Did you know the dot over a lowercase "i" or "j" is called a "tittle"?
Alright! Did you know an octopus has blue blood because it contains copper?
Did you know honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient tombs that are over 3000 years old!
Cows have best friends and get stressed out when separated.
A day on Mercury lasts 1408 hours. Making it longer than a year on Mercury.
A group of porcupines is called a "prickle."
Butterflies can taste with their feet.
Ravens can imitate human speech.
A gentoo penguin presents a pebble to a potential mate as a courtship ritual.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water. A phenomenon called the Mpemba effect.
The first computer virus was called "Creeper" and was created in 1971. It displayed the message: "I'M THE CREEPER: CATCH ME IF YOU CAN."
The first computer programmer was a woman named Ada Lovelace. She wrote the first algorithm intended to be processed by a machine in the mid-1800s
Sea otters hold hands when they sleep to keep from drifting apart.
Bananas are berries! But strawberries aren’t.
The heart of a blue whale weighs as much as a small car.
The heart of a blue whale weighs as much as a small car.
Pineapples take about two years to grow from planting to harvest.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time! Equaling 1/100th of a second.
Ants don’t sleep
column3: but they do take short breaks to rest.

column2: LeBron James was the first player in NBA history to play with his son at the same time in the same team.
Did you know Kobe Bryant is the only basketball player to win an oscar? In 2018 Bryant won the Academy Award for best animated short film.
Stan Lee made cameo appearances in almost every Marvel movie until his passing. but his first on-screen Marvel cameo was in the 1989 TV movie The Trial of the Incredible Hulk
column3: where he appeared as a jury member in a courtroom scene.

column2: Did you know a teaspoon of a neutron star would weigh about six billion tons?
The ocean is so vast that more than 80% of it remains unexplored.
Dogs’ noses are wet to help them absorb scent chemicals better.
A cat’s nose print is as unique as a human fingerprint.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
Bees can recognize human faces! like how we recognize each other.
It takes about 50 licks to finish one scoop of ice cream.
Some trees can live over 5000 years.
White chocolate isn’t technically chocolate because it doesn’t contain cocoa solids.
The moon is moving away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches per year.
The world’s most expensive cheese is made from donkey milk and is called Pule cheese.
There’s an underwater volcano in the Pacific Ocean that erupts so frequently it’s nicknamed "the soda bottle."
Lightning can strike the same place multiple times. The Empire State Building is struck about 25 times a year.
Greenland is the world’s largest island that isn’t a continent.
Your stomach gets a new lining every 3-4 days to prevent it from digesting itself.
Golf is the only sport ever played on the moon.
Ketchup was once sold as medicine in the 1830s.
Bats are the only mammals capable of sustained flight.
The fastest train in the world is the Shanghai Maglev! Which can reach speeds of 267 mph (430 km/h).
The first photograph ever taken required an exposure time of 8 hours.
Earth’s magnetic field is flipping. It happens roughly every 300k years and we’re overdue for the next flip.
Snails can sleep for up to three years if conditions aren’t right for them.
Monarch butterflies migrate up to 3k miles each year the longest migration of any insect.
The largest denomination of U.S. currency ever printed was the $100k bill featuring Woodrow Wilson.
The sentence "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog" uses every letter in the English alphabet.
A single pencil can draw a line about 35 miles long or write roughly 50k English words.
The first breakfast cereal ever invented was granola! Created in 1863.
The Arctic Tern holds the record for the longest migration. Traveling around 44K miles annually!
The human eye can distinguish about 10 million different colors.
